column4: is there a way to have synaptic show both i386 and amd64 packages?  I have some of each installed, via --force-architecture
although it seems like a very bad idea to me
ubuntu is not setup to be multi lib
sometimes needed when 64bit packages aren't available
yes, but ubuntu isn't setup multi lib
ehh.. it has some 32 bit support packages
it works fine.. just trying to view everything
no, you need a base set of 32bit libs to use 32bit libraries, which maintaining can be quite complex
yes.. ubuntu provides those
anyways.. sounds like synaptic doesn't handle it ..
try putting both the 32bit and 64bit repo's in, I'm not sure how that would work out
yeah.. not sure either.. but I can always take em back out if I need to.. thanks
actually wait.. there are no differences in the repo names
ahhh it's doen on your !arch now rather than repo name
what is !arch?
your machine architechture
not finding !arch anywhere
sorry, that was miss-leading, you won't find it as an option
the repo's contents are determained by your machines arch x86_64, i386 etc
oh.. I see what you're saying
I'll mess around with that.. thanks
lol.. ehh duh.. I'd need a 32-bit synaptic for this to work.. okay I need to mess around with this some more.. thanks I think you've pointed me in the right direction
no problem
I've never done it that way, I'd expect 32bit compatability packages that are SUPPORTED (key word) being held in the amd64 repo
